newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Mercenaries land on PNG island - rebels.
newsitem.headline: Mercenaries land on PNG island - rebels.

text.p: Mercenaries hired by the Papua New Guinea government have landed on the island of Bougainville, supporters of the island's secessionists said on Saturday.
The rebel Bougainville Revolutionary Army had detected 170 of the mercenaries on the island, a spokeswoman for the secessionists told the Australian Associated Press in Sydney.
The Australian Foreign Affairs Department meanwhile said any Australians on the mineral-rich island could be mistaken for mercenaries and should leave as soon as possible.

"Press reports that members of the Bougainville Revolutionary Army have orders to shoot on sight 'anybody without a clearance' must be taken seriously since there is a danger they could apply to any foreigners in Bougainville," the department said in a statement.
Papua New Guinea said last week it had hired Sandline International, a British-based supplier of mercenaries that had subcontracted the job to South Africa's Executive Outcomes, a private army.
Papua New Guinea said it had hired Sandline to train its soldiers waging a nine-year war against the rebels on Bougainville, which is 800 km (500 miles) north east of the capital, Port Moresby.
Australia has led the international diplomatic push against the use of mercenaries, warning Port Moresby that its persistence with the plan would damage its international relations.
Australian media reports said that the deal involved up to 150 mercenaries but that only about 40 were expected to go to Bougainville.
